About

About

Hi, my name is Claudio d’Angelis and this is my website, I’m a freelance developer and IT consultant based in Italy.

I’m currently employed in the advertising technology (ad tech) industry.

Besides general purpose programming in Go or JavaScript, my areas of expertise include:

  • Tasks Automation
  • Web Scraping
  • Data Mining

I’m a big fan of Frank Zappa and Banco Del Mutuo Soccorso and travel a lot.

Timeline

2018

  • started working on the Banco project

2017

  • Focused 100% on my day job
  • Visited norway

2016

  • Attended HackInBo 2016, Bologna, Italy
  • Started working in the Ad Tech industry
  • Visited Portugal, Greece and central Italy

2015

  • Helped writing Dart By Example by working as a technical reviewer

  • Open-sourced Popup For Keep™, available on the Chrome Web Store

2014

  • Presented a talk about Dart and Polymer at GDG DevFest 2014 in Rome together with Giovanni Laquidara
  • Helped writing Dart Cookbook working as a technical reviewer
  • Started working on mobile apps as a day job for a short time
  • Talked about Dart at the University of L’Aquila together with Giovanni Laquidara
  • Presented a talk and a codelab about Dart and Firefox OS at AppDays @ Pordenone (Italy)
  • Presented a talk about Dart at Codemotion Rome together with Giovanni Laquidara
  • Joined GDG Roma L-ab

2013

  • Third and last episode about Dart for Google Developers Live
  • Second episode of an ongoing series about Dart for Google Developers Live
  • Started working on the unplug2shutdown project
  • First episode, in Italian, of an ongoing series about Dart for the Google Developers Live program

2012

  • Started writing articles and tutorials about Dart at the now defunct technology blog Engeene.it (+50 posts)
  • Wrote my first line of Dart code <3

2011

  • I quit my job and enrolled at the University of Tor Vergata in Rome to study computer science

2009

  • Moved to Rome, started working as a configuration manager for digitization projects at several pontifical institutes

2004

  • Started working in the digitization area: extensive and super-fascinating experience

1985

:-)
